An intern leaked half of our RSA key digits in a chat. The message "4093295492336631609964061130619893742912335157729844452181423548224039191629253612466544805198289430407227548592305243414283880146462216630956197807682761" was encrypted—can you recover it from this risky exposure?

The flag format is flag{...}
n=5706666120677328488585182455284497212058936869761874259352703502653930242795620508063147331124223865118570811546940275195764355744982715991039935877033341, e=1811172963731959359008155533034594426515081042897418862063429726650947659722490568107834063394439940143080492062835147394367520134703898467717160737379181, partial_p=15547955307932056192

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{k77mtep8}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 4093295492336631609964061130619893742912335157729844452181423548224039191629253612466544805198289430407227548592305243414283880146462216630956197807682761
vulnerability: partial key exposure
hint: A partial exposure of a prime number's bits can significantly weaken RSA security. Look into lattice-based techniques like Coppersmith's attack.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=5706666120677328488585182455284497212058936869761874259352703502653930242795620508063147331124223865118570811546940275195764355744982715991039935877033341, e=1811172963731959359008155533034594426515081042897418862063429726650947659722490568107834063394439940143080492062835147394367520134703898467717160737379181, partial_p=15547955307932056192
extra_info: p=97596097245134864425458539245229207635183140215382371193404209650237337226911, q=58472277906192647964220464620277010835711068235455666258508636930656238828131, φ(n)=5706666120677328488585182455284497212058936869761874259352703502653930242795464439687996003611834186114705305328469380987313517707530803144459042300978300
